review.title: A Case Study in Knowledge Discovery and Elicitation in an Intelligent Tutoring Application
review.abstract: The most successful Bayesian network applications (BN) to date have been built through expert knowledge gathering, which is difficult and time-consuming, leading to recent interest in automated methods of learning BN from data. We present a case study on constructing a BN in an intelligent tutoring application, especially decimal misunderstandings. We describe the BN construction using expert surveys, and then examine how certain pre-existing automated methods of knowledge gathering could support the BN knowledge engineering process.
